FY1920.Q82: We have begun these efforts.  The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in some ways sped up our progress (e.g., on electronic systems implementation)  and slowed others (updated guidance, website, materials) but we are making great progress.
FY1920.Q83: We have successfully developed many new guidances, updated forms, and compliance web resources.  We are midway through completion of the stated goals.  In the assessment period, the loss of fulltime Veterinarian and COVID-19 response did impact completion.
FY1920.Q84: Decided not to pursue the name change at present.
FY1920.Q92: We have begun these efforts.  The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in some ways sped up our progress (e.g., on electronic systems implementation)  and slowed others (updated guidance, website, materials) but we are making great progress.
FY1920.Q93: This goal dovetails with the first goal, with respect to development of updated guidances and procedures.  This is in progress and substantially completed.  We are developing a new database to track study protocols submitted for IRB or IACUC review.  The database will allow for automated tracking and recording of reviews and will provide the data necessary for quarterly review.  COVID-19 response has impacted the  completion.
FY1920.Q94: Due to necessity to work smarter and remotely, we have completed phase one of working entirely electronically.  What we now need is to ensure that we have an electronic solution for compliant recordkeeping.  This is in progress.
FY1920.Q131_7: I have additional achievement(s) which were not in the list above.
FY1920.Q132_4:
Office of Regulatory and Research Compliance and Lab Animal Resources were able to swiftly and efficiently respond to
the COVID-19 crisis and campus shut down. We were able to continue to support faculty and students in their research.
FY1920.Q132_5:
Office of Regulatory and Research Compliance continued to administer and manage the University at Albanyâs research
compliance programs including, use of animals, research involving human subjects, and research integrity.
FY1920.Q132_6:
Office of Regulatory and Research Compliance and Lab Animal Resources were able to swiftly and efficiently respond to
resignation of the Attending Veterinarian. The Assistant Vice President/Research Compliance Officer managed the
transition process from having a campus Attending Veterinarian to a contract Consulting Veterinarian. Additionally, Ms.
Bonilla worked closely to advise and assist campus researchers with respect to obtaining their own individual state and
federal controlled substance licenses (from having just one institutional license that had been managed by the former
Attending Veterinarian.)
FY1920.1819Mission: The mission of the Office for Regulatory and Research Compliance (ORRC) is to provide internal oversight on compliance relating to the performance of human and animal research, and research integrity.  ORRC emphasis is to ensure the rights and well-being of human and animal subjects, ensure regulatory compliance, support our investigators and staff, protect the University and advance science.
FY1920.1819Vision: To foster a strong ethical culture at UAlbany and promote mutual trust and community confidence in the research carried out by the University at Albany.  Assist faculty, research staff, and students in understanding federal, state and university research compliance standards and regulations.
FY1920.1819Goal1: Facilitate and strengthen Campus Research Compliance Programs.
FY1920.1819Activities1: Administration of University at Albany Research Compliance Programs associated with the protection of human participants in research and use of animals in research, teaching, and testing.
FY1920.1819Metrics1: Develop educational offerings and materials, guidance to campus research community to assist University faculty, staff, and students understand and meet their ethical and compliance obligations with respect human subjects and use of animals.  New forms, guidances, and training materials library will be created and available to campus community.
FY1920.1819Goal2: Ensure effective post approval monitoring and . Quality assessment (QA) and Quality improvement (QI).  QA is evaluation of whether or not activities meet defined standards. (QI) is a process initiated to improve a practice or procedure and to institutionalize the practice. QA/QI activities comprise a critical component of the research protections programs.
FY1920.1819Activities2: Post approval monitoring is an examination of the research and study documents (approved protocols) to assure that human subjects, animals and that investigators and compliance committees are in compliance with applicable University and Federal regulations.
FY1920.1819Metrics2: Quarterly QA/QI evaluations will be conducted quarterly.  Reports will be used to identify areas for communication, education, training, and process review and improvement.
FY1920.1819Goal1:Results: We have successfully developed many new guidances, updated forms, and compliance web resources.  We are midway through completion of the stated goals.  In the assessment period, the loss of fulltime Veterinarian and COVID-19 response did impact completion.
FY1920.1819Goal1:ChangeofPlan: Decided not to pursue the name change at present.
FY1920.1819Goal2:Results: This goal dovetails with the first goal, with respect to development of updated guidances and procedures.  This is in progress and substantially completed.  We are developing a new database to track study protocols submitted for IRB or IACUC review.  The database will allow for automated tracking and recording of reviews and will provide the data necessary for quarterly review.  COVID-19 response has impacted the  completion.
FY1920.1920Goal1: Facilitate and strengthen University at Albany Research Compliance Programs.
FY1920.1920Activities1: Administration of University at Albany Research Compliance Programs associated with the protection of human participants in research and use of animals in research, teaching, and testing.
FY1920.1920Metrics1: Develop updated processes, educational offerings, materials, guidance and forms for efficient and compliant administration of human subjects protections and campus animal welfare program.  ; 1.	Completed transition from paper-based processes to online, electronic submission, review, and study protocol recordkeeping.; 2.	Completed updated, revised, and fully electronic forms, guidance, and training materials. ; 3.	Completed new study submission database for tracking and quality assurance reporting.;
